thread.title: Kirsten Flipkens stuns Caroline Wozniacki in Linz
thread.title_full: Kirsten Flipkens stuns Caroline Wozniacki in Linz

title: Kirsten Flipkens stuns Caroline Wozniacki in Linz
text:
Kirsten Flipkens stuns Caroline Wozniacki in Linz 15 Oct 2015 19:02:00 
comments 
Kirsten Flipkens caused a huge upset in the second round of the Generali Ladies Linz on Thursday by dispatching world number 11 and second seed Caroline Wozniacki in straight sets. 
Ranked 110, Flipkens had last played Wozniacki in 2007 in Las Vegas, but left little to chance in Austria to avenge that defeat. 
The first set on centre court took nearly an hour as Flipkens raced into a 3-1 lead and held on to take it 6-4. 
Belgium's Flipkens began the second set in similar fashion to the first, breaking Wozniacki early for a 2-1 advantage and again clinched it 6-4 to seal victory in one hour and 33 minutes. 
Wozniacki was the last of the top five seeds left in Linz, while Flipkens will take heart from the win as she chases just a second WTA tour singles title. 
Qualifier Aleksandra Krunic continued her great run in Austria with a straight-sets victory over Germany's Mona Barthel to progress to the third round. 
Krunic produced an upset of her own on Wednesday when she knocked out third seed and US Open finalist Roberta Vinci and on Thursday she was a 7-6 (8/6) 6-3 winner. 
Seventh seed Anastasia Pavlyuchenkova had very few problems in seeing off qualifier Stefanie Voegele of Switzerland 6-4 6-0, and she will next face Krunic. 
Sweden's Johanna Larsson, who had beaten Andrea Petkovic in the previous round, booked a meeting with American Madison Brengle after beating Alison Van Uytvanck 6-4 7-6 (7/2) in a match lasting nearly two hours. Related Sport News
